newsitem.title: BULGARIA: Bulgaria May inflation quickens to 5.6 pct mth/mth.
newsitem.headline: Bulgaria May inflation quickens to 5.6 pct mth/mth.

text.p: Bulgaria's monthly consumer prices rose by 5.6 percent in May after falling by 0.7 percent the month before, the National Statistics Institute (NSI) said on Tuesday.
Cumulative inflation for the first five months was 479.4 percent. A year on year inflation figure for May will be available later this month.
BULGARIAN CONSUMER PRICES MAY APRIL MAY'96
BREAKDOWN (cumulative inflation since Jan 1 in brackets) foods +9.1 (+511.6)
Monthly inflation for May could have been around two to three percent last month if a rise in some food prices has been smaller, a NSI official who declined to be named told Reuters.
Prices of fresh fruits rose 22.1 percent in May month on month, vegetables rose 89 percent with potatoes posting the biggest price rise of 125 percent.
Meat prices increased 9.3 percent last month.
Consumer price inflation for 1997 was assumed at 566 percent in this year's draft budget yet to be approved by parliament. Annual inflation for 1996 was 310.8 percent.

Inflation projections were made under a fixed exchange rate of 1,000 levs per mark, to be introduced on July 1 along with a currency board arrangement recommended by the International Monetary Fund to stabilise the economy.

Inflation was expected to slow down under the currency board system as central bank lending to the government and commercial banks would be banned to prevent the printing of money. -- Sofia Newsroom, (++359-2) 911 88
